Please reconsider Squad!

Think of the empty donut-shaped-holes this will leave in our hearts!

Why not just adding a silver Round8 for xenon?

I had no problem with previous design changes, like the space plane parts. The crafts were good looking and functional again after a few modifications. The only alternative here is the oscar-b, so design and appearance will change a lot. Backwards compatibility is broken.

Squad, "Just mod it back" is absolutely NO excuse, until you can explain why the workaround (Round8 LFO and Round8 Xenon) should be impossible or too hard.

Speaking of plane parts, I still have the Porkjet changes to the wings stuck in the throat. While the parts are prettier for sure, they are bigger and heavier than the previous counterparts for no particularly good stated reason AFAIK. The difference is not big for most parts , but I have a good bunch of planes stuck in the yard that became unable to fly as designed because of those changes :/
Jeez, you guys, just get the mod that keeps them the same in 1.0, easily done, just copy and rename the part titles, and you're good to go. Or do you gentlemen not use mods?

> 
> Or do you gentlemen not use mods?

I, for one, do not, except for EVE and a couple of helpers like KER and Alarm Clock. I don't use part mods because I like to measure my ships (in a friendly way) against others' who also play with just stock.

> 
> Jeez, you guys, just get the mod that keeps them the same in 1.0, easily done, just copy and rename the part titles, and you're good to go. Or do you gentlemen not use mods?

As mentioned in my previous post, this is a very lame excuse for a developer, because you can get away with almost everything with that as long as the core game is more or less stable, stop developing the game and simply rely on modders to do the rest.

This is breaking backwards compability for absolutely no reason.

Mods can be incompatible with each other, stock components are not...

Felt like supporting the ROUND-8 even more

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115824-The-Oscar-B-Squasher-Support-the-ROUND-8%21?p=1842515#post1842515](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115824-The-Oscar-B-Squasher-Support-the-ROUND-8%21?p=1842515#post1842515)

> 
> Jeez, you guys, just get the mod that keeps them the same in 1.0, easily done, just copy and rename the part titles, and you're good to go. Or do you gentlemen not use mods?

1. There are indeed people who don't use mods, or don't use *part* mods, etc

2. Various challenges and such usually only allow very short lists of mods (and often NO part mods), or no mods at all

3. Mods are often orphaned and released under restrictive licenses and thus die, leaving a constant scramble for updating and/or the possible craft-incompatibility of "rolling your own" etc.

4. See above re: phoning it in development wise

This goes beyond just a little doughnut tank, and into the problem that KSP is kinda lacking in the small-tanks department. People who *grok* Tsiolkovsky's equation understand that bigger is *not* better. Removing the Round8 basically makes the Oscar-B the ONLY sub-FL-T100 rocket fuel tank... we need more tanks in that range, not LESS!

(I'm not opposed to Xenon tanks appearing, but not at the cost of LF/O tanks, especially considering the lifter-class xenon engines and #lolsolar of KSP is one of the fundamental #lolsokerbal problems)

> 
> 3. Mods are often orphaned and released under restrictive licenses and thus die

That's why I don't use non-free mods.

No part mods. Ever. Squad saying if you want to keep it, mod it back in is a **SLAP IN THE FACE.**

 Why are they being so silent about this????
